Comparing Folder Contents

The View Comparison utility can compare the contents of a folder in the source pane with those of a folder in the target pane. However, this comparison does not extend to the files in their child folders. To compare these files, you must select corresponding child folders from the source and target panes.

To compare folder contents:

  1. Open the view to be used as the source.

  2. Click View > Compare/Merge to select the view that will serve as the target.

  3. Select a folder from the source view. The application will then search for the folder in the target view that is the best match for the selected folder.

    4. When it finds one or more matches, a check mark appears in front of those folders in the target view. For example, when the same folder is shared multiple times in the target view, you see multiple check marks. It is possible for no matching folders to exist.

  4. Select a folder from the target view. You may select a folder with a check mark or any other folder with which you wish to make a comparison.

  5. Select a tab from the lower pane to display the child folders or items in the selected folders.

  6. Review, compare, share, merge, and delete folders or items, as required.
